title: Ref

version.description: A version number in MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH format where the MINOR and PATCH fields are optional and the fields may have leading zeros (so 01.00.00 is the same as 1.0.0 or 1).

lastChange.description: The timestamp when the entity was changed the last time.

categoryPath.description: The full path of the category of the referenced entity from top to bottom, e.g. `"Elementary flows", "Emissions to air", "unspecified"`.

library.description: If the entity that is described by this reference is part of a library, this field contains the identifier of that library. The identifier is typically just the combination of the library name and version.

refUnit.description: This field is only valid for references of flows or impact categories and contains the name (symbol) of the reference unit of that respective flow or impact category.

location.description: This field is only valid for references of processes or flows and contains the location name or code of that respective process or flow.

flowType.description: In case of a reference to a flow, this field can contain the type of flow that is referenced.

processType.description: In case of a reference to a process, this fiel can contain the type of process that is referenced.

description: A Ref is a reference to a [RootEntity]. When serializing an entity (e.g. a [Process]) that references another standalone entity (e.g. a [Flow] in an [Exchange]) we do not want to write the complete referenced entity into the serialized JSON object but just a reference. However, the reference contains some meta-data like name, category path etc. that are useful to display.
